snippet: A feud between the government and sports federations over how public money is spent could mean Mexican athletes in Rio would compete under the I.O.C. banner.
abstract: International Olympic Committee can ban Mexico from 2016 Olympics if it perceives Mexican government is meddling in finances or politics of nation's sports federations.
lead_paragraph: A feud between the government and sports federations over how public money is spent could mean Mexican athletes in Rio would compete under the I.O.C. banner.

headline.main: Mexico’s Participation in ’16 Olympics Imperiled by Intramural Dispute
